definition: to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]

sentences.english: The neon which symbolizes material (or "materialism") has all of a sudden been deprived of its target.
sentences.chinese: 象征物欲的霓虹突然被扯脱了其所施欲的对象。

sentences.english: Nature satisfies by its loveliness, and without any mixture of corporeal benefit…
sentences.chinese: 自然之所以悦人是因其可爱，不掺杂任何物欲之念。

sentences.english: Materialistic, warm taste moved closer, love is tapering off.
sentences.chinese: 物欲横流，暖味越走越近，爱情却渐行渐远。

sentences.english: Nature satisfies by its loveliness, and without any mixture of corporeal benefit.
sentences.chinese: 自然的悦人是因其可爱，不掺杂任何物欲之念。

sentences.english: We are all changed, in this materialistic age.
sentences.chinese: 我们都变了，在这个物欲横流的时代。

sentences.english: While of course it has to overcome the gravity of material desires.
sentences.chinese: 当然，心灵的飞升需要克服物欲的重力。

sentences.english: Stop expanding and keep it simple.
sentences.chinese: 停止物欲增长，保持简朴。

sentences.english: Nature satisfies by its loveliness , and without and mixture of corporeal benefit .
sentences.chinese: 自然的悦人是因其可爱，不掺杂任何物欲之念。

sentences.english: It's more of a "high money" age.
sentences.chinese: 现在是一个物欲横流金钱至上的时代。

sentences.english: But Easterlin's evidence points to the persistence of materialism.
sentences.chinese: 但伊斯特林的论证却指出人类的物欲永无止境。

definition: bottomless pit of desire (idiom); insatiable greed/carnal cravings are never satisfied and are a main obstruction on the path to enlightenment
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
